teams.description: All teams whose issues can be accessed by the user. This might be different from `administrableTeams`, which also includes teams whose settings can be changed by the user.

first.description: The number of items to forward paginate (used with after). Defaults to 50.

after.description: A cursor to be used with first for forward pagination.

last.description: The number of items to backward paginate (used with before). Defaults to 50.

before.description: A cursor to be used with last for backward pagination.

includeArchived.description: Should archived resources be included (default: false).

orderBy.description: By which field should the pagination order by. Available options are createdAt (default) and updatedAt.

first.description: The number of items to forward paginate (used with after). Defaults to 50.

after.description: A cursor to be used with first for forward pagination.

last.description: The number of items to backward paginate (used with before). Defaults to 50.

before.description: A cursor to be used with last for backward pagination.

includeArchived.description: Should archived resources be included (default: false).

orderBy.description: By which field should the pagination order by. Available options are createdAt (default) and updatedAt.

issue.description: Get a single issue by ID.

id.description: The UUID of the issue to retrieve.

first.description: The number of items to forward paginate (used with after). Defaults to 50.

after.description: A cursor to be used with first for forward pagination.

last.description: The number of items to backward paginate (used with before). Defaults to 50.

before.description: A cursor to be used with last for backward pagination.

includeArchived.description: Should archived resources be included (default: false).

orderBy.description: By which field should the pagination order by. Available options are createdAt (default) and updatedAt.

first.description: The number of items to forward paginate (used with after). Defaults to 50.

after.description: A cursor to be used with first for forward pagination.

last.description: The number of items to backward paginate (used with before). Defaults to 50.

before.description: A cursor to be used with last for backward pagination.

includeArchived.description: Should archived resources be included (default: false).

includeDisabled.description: Should query return disabled/suspended users (default: false).

orderBy.description: By which field should the pagination order by. Available options are createdAt (default) and updatedAt.

assigneeId.description: The identifier of the user to assign the issue to.

completedAt.description: The date when the issue was completed (e.g. if importing from another system). Must be a date in the past and after createdAt date. Cannot be provided with an incompatible workflow state.

createAsUser.description: Create issue as a user with the provided name. This option is only available to OAuth applications creating issues in `actor=app` mode.

createdAt.description: The date when the issue was created (e.g. if importing from another system). Must be a date in the past. If none is provided, the backend will generate the time as now.

cycleId.description: The cycle associated with the issue.

delegateId.description: The identifier of the agent user to delegate the issue to.

description.description: The issue description in markdown format.

descriptionData.description: [Internal] The issue description as a Prosemirror document.

displayIconUrl.description: Provide an external user avatar URL. Can only be used in conjunction with the `createAsUser` options. This option is only available to OAuth applications creating comments in `actor=app` mode.

dueDate.description: The date at which the issue is due.

estimate.description: The estimated complexity of the issue.

id.description: The identifier in UUID v4 format. If none is provided, the backend will generate one.

labelIds.description: The identifiers of the issue labels associated with this ticket.

lastAppliedTemplateId.description: The ID of the last template applied to the issue.

parentId.description: The identifier of the parent issue. Can be a UUID or issue identifier (e.g., 'LIN-123').

preserveSortOrderOnCreate.description: Whether the passed sort order should be preserved.

priority.description: The priority of the issue. 0 = No priority, 1 = Urgent, 2 = High, 3 = Normal, 4 = Low.

prioritySortOrder.description: The position of the issue related to other issues, when ordered by priority.

projectId.description: The project associated with the issue.

projectMilestoneId.description: The project milestone associated with the issue.

referenceCommentId.description: The comment the issue is referencing.

slaBreachesAt.description: [Internal] The timestamp at which an issue will be considered in breach of SLA.

slaStartedAt.description: [Internal] The timestamp at which the issue's SLA was started.

slaType.description: The SLA day count type for the issue. Whether SLA should be business days only or calendar days (default).

sortOrder.description: The position of the issue related to other issues.

sourceCommentId.description: The comment the issue is created from.

sourcePullRequestCommentId.description: [Internal] The pull request comment the issue is created from.

stateId.description: The team state of the issue.

subIssueSortOrder.description: The position of the issue in parent's sub-issue list.

subscriberIds.description: The identifiers of the users subscribing to this ticket.

teamId.description: The identifier of the team associated with the issue.

templateId.description: The identifier of a template the issue should be created from. If other values are provided in the input, they will override template values.

useDefaultTemplate.description: Whether to use the default template for the team. When set to true, the default template of this team based on user's membership will be applied.

id.description: The identifier of the issue to update.

input.description: A partial issue object to update the issue with.

addedLabelIds.description: The identifiers of the issue labels to be added to this issue.

assigneeId.description: The identifier of the user to assign the issue to.

autoClosedByParentClosing.description: Whether the issue was automatically closed because its parent issue was closed.

cycleId.description: The cycle associated with the issue.

delegateId.description: The identifier of the agent user to delegate the issue to.

description.description: The issue description in markdown format.

descriptionData.description: [Internal] The issue description as a Prosemirror document.

dueDate.description: The date at which the issue is due.

estimate.description: The estimated complexity of the issue.

labelIds.description: The identifiers of the issue labels associated with this ticket.

lastAppliedTemplateId.description: The ID of the last template applied to the issue.

parentId.description: The identifier of the parent issue. Can be a UUID or issue identifier (e.g., 'LIN-123').

priority.description: The priority of the issue. 0 = No priority, 1 = Urgent, 2 = High, 3 = Normal, 4 = Low.

prioritySortOrder.description: The position of the issue related to other issues, when ordered by priority.

projectId.description: The project associated with the issue.

projectMilestoneId.description: The project milestone associated with the issue.

removedLabelIds.description: The identifiers of the issue labels to be removed from this issue.

slaBreachesAt.description: [Internal] The timestamp at which an issue will be considered in breach of SLA.

slaStartedAt.description: [Internal] The timestamp at which the issue's SLA was started.

slaType.description: The SLA day count type for the issue. Whether SLA should be business days only or calendar days (default).

snoozedById.description: The identifier of the user who snoozed the issue.

snoozedUntilAt.description: The time until an issue will be snoozed in Triage view.

sortOrder.description: The position of the issue related to other issues.

stateId.description: The team state of the issue.

subIssueSortOrder.description: The position of the issue in parent's sub-issue list.

subscriberIds.description: The identifiers of the users subscribing to this ticket.

teamId.description: The identifier of the team associated with the issue.

trashed.description: Whether the issue has been trashed.

body.description: The comment content in markdown format.

bodyData.description: [Internal] The comment content as a Prosemirror document.

createAsUser.description: Create comment as a user with the provided name. This option is only available to OAuth applications creating comments in `actor=app` mode.

createOnSyncedSlackThread.description: Flag to indicate this comment should be created on the issue's synced Slack comment thread. If no synced Slack comment thread exists, the mutation will fail.

createdAt.description: The date when the comment was created (e.g. if importing from another system). Must be a date in the past. If none is provided, the backend will generate the time as now.

displayIconUrl.description: Provide an external user avatar URL. Can only be used in conjunction with the `createAsUser` options. This option is only available to OAuth applications creating comments in `actor=app` mode.

doNotSubscribeToIssue.description: Flag to prevent auto subscription to the issue the comment is created on.

documentContentId.description: The document content to associate the comment with.

id.description: The identifier in UUID v4 format. If none is provided, the backend will generate one.

initiativeUpdateId.description: The initiative update to associate the comment with.

issueId.description: The issue to associate the comment with. Can be a UUID or issue identifier (e.g., 'LIN-123').

parentId.description: The parent comment under which to nest a current comment.

postId.description: The post to associate the comment with.

projectUpdateId.description: The project update to associate the comment with.

quotedText.description: The text that this comment references. Only defined for inline comments.

subscriberIds.description: [INTERNAL] The identifiers of the users subscribing to this comment thread.

teamCreate.description: Creates a new team. The user who creates the team will automatically be added as a member to the newly created team.

copySettingsFromTeamId.description: The team id to copy settings from, if any.

autoArchivePeriod.description: Period after which closed and completed issues are automatically archived, in months. 0 means disabled.

autoClosePeriod.description: Period after which issues are automatically closed, in months.

autoCloseStateId.description: The canceled workflow state which auto closed issues will be set to.

cycleCooldownTime.description: The cooldown time after each cycle in weeks.

cycleDuration.description: The duration of each cycle in weeks.

cycleIssueAutoAssignCompleted.description: Auto assign completed issues to current active cycle setting.

cycleIssueAutoAssignStarted.description: Auto assign started issues to current active cycle setting.

cycleLockToActive.description: Only allow issues issues with cycles in Active Issues.

cycleStartDay.description: The day of the week that a new cycle starts.

defaultIssueEstimate.description: What to use as an default estimate for unestimated issues.

defaultProjectTemplateId.description: The identifier of the default project template of this team.

defaultTemplateForMembersId.description: The identifier of the default template for members of this team.

defaultTemplateForNonMembersId.description: The identifier of the default template for non-members of this team.

groupIssueHistory.description: Whether to group recent issue history entries.

id.description: The identifier in UUID v4 format. If none is provided, the backend will generate one.

inheritIssueEstimation.description: Whether the team should inherit estimation settings from its parent. Only applies to sub-teams.

inheritProductIntelligenceScope.description: [Internal] Whether the team should inherit its product intelligence scope from its parent. Only applies to sub-teams.

inheritWorkflowStatuses.description: [Internal] Whether the team should inherit workflow statuses from its parent.

issueEstimationAllowZero.description: Whether to allow zeros in issues estimates.

issueEstimationExtended.description: Whether to add additional points to the estimate scale.

issueEstimationType.description: The issue estimation type to use. Must be one of 'notUsed', 'exponential', 'fibonacci', 'linear', 'tShirt'.

key.description: The key of the team. If not given, the key will be generated based on the name of the team.

markedAsDuplicateWorkflowStateId.description: The workflow state into which issues are moved when they are marked as a duplicate of another issue.

private.description: Internal. Whether the team is private or not.

productIntelligenceScope.description: [Internal] The scope of product intelligence suggestion data for the team.

requirePriorityToLeaveTriage.description: Whether an issue needs to have a priority set before leaving triage.

setIssueSortOrderOnStateChange.description: Whether to move issues to bottom of the column when changing state.

triageEnabled.description: Whether triage mode is enabled for the team.

upcomingCycleCount.description: How many upcoming cycles to create.

replaceTeamLabels.description: Whether to replace all team-specific labels with the same name with this newly created workspace label (default: false).

id.description: The identifier in UUID v4 format. If none is provided, the backend will generate one.

isGroup.description: Whether the label is a group.

parentId.description: The identifier of the parent label.

teamId.description: The team associated with the label. If not given, the label will be associated with the entire workspace.

first.description: The number of items to forward paginate (used with after). Defaults to 50.

after.description: A cursor to be used with first for forward pagination.

last.description: The number of items to backward paginate (used with before). Defaults to 50.

before.description: A cursor to be used with last for backward pagination.

includeArchived.description: Should archived resources be included (default: false).

orderBy.description: By which field should the pagination order by. Available options are createdAt (default) and updatedAt.

first.description: The number of items to forward paginate (used with after). Defaults to 50.

after.description: A cursor to be used with first for forward pagination.

last.description: The number of items to backward paginate (used with before). Defaults to 50.

before.description: A cursor to be used with last for backward pagination.

includeArchived.description: Should archived resources be included (default: false).

orderBy.description: By which field should the pagination order by. Available options are createdAt (default) and updatedAt.

id.description: The identifier of the comment to update.

input.description: A partial comment object to update the comment with.

skipEditedAt.description: [INTERNAL] Flag to prevent setting editedAt when updating bodyData (used for background uploads).

bodyData.description: [Internal] The comment content as a Prosemirror document.

doNotSubscribeToIssue.description: [INTERNAL] Flag to prevent auto subscription to the issue the comment is updated on.

quotedText.description: The text that this comment references. Only defined for inline comments.

resolvingCommentId.description: [INTERNAL] The child comment that resolves this thread.

resolvingUserId.description: [INTERNAL] The user who resolved this thread.

subscriberIds.description: [INTERNAL] The identifiers of the users subscribing to this comment.

id.description: The identifier of the comment to delete.
The identifier of the label to update.

input.description: A partial label object to update.

replaceTeamLabels.description: Whether to replace all team-specific labels with the same name with this updated workspace label (default: false).

isGroup.description: Whether the label is a group.

parentId.description: The identifier of the parent label.

workflowStateCreate.description: Creates a new state, adding it to the workflow of a team.

id.description: The identifier in UUID v4 format. If none is provided, the backend will generate one.

teamId.description: The team associated with the state.

workflowStateArchive.description: Archives a state. Only states with issues that have all been archived can be archived.

id.description: The identifier of the state to archive.

input.description: The team membership object to create.

id.description: The identifier in UUID v4 format. If none is provided, the backend will generate one.

owner.description: Internal. Whether the user is the owner of the team.

sortOrder.description: The position of the item in the users list.

teamId.description: The identifier of the team associated with the membership.

userId.description: The identifier of the user associated with the membership.

overrideCreatedAt.description: Used by client undo operations. Should not be set directly.

id.description: The identifier in UUID v4 format. If none is provided, the backend will generate one.

issueId.description: The identifier of the issue that is related to another issue. Can be a UUID or issue identifier (e.g., 'LIN-123').

relatedIssueId.description: The identifier of the related issue. Can be a UUID or issue identifier (e.g., 'LIN-123').

type.description: The type of relation of the issue to the related issue. Valid values: blocks, duplicate, related.
